title: ViewChild & ContentChild
subject: Angular
theory: @ViewChild allows a parent to access a child component or DOM element inside its own template. @ContentChild allows access to projected content (ng-content).

examples.explanation: Direct DOM access wrapper using ElementRef.

common_mistakes.correction: ViewChild is only available in ngAfterViewInit.

interview_questions.question: Difference between ViewChild and ContentChild?
interview_questions.answer: ViewChild selects elements from the component's own template. ContentChild selects elements projected into the component (via ng-content) from the parent.

real_world_use_cases.description: Parent calls `modal.open()` directly on the child instance.

summary: These decorators provide imperative access to the component hierarchy and DOM.
